metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14970 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: In lib/ofp-util.c in Open vSwitch (OvS) before 2.8.1, there are multiple memory leaks while parsing malformed OpenFlow group mod messages. NOTE: the vendor disputes the relevance of this report, stating "it can only be triggered by an OpenFlow controller, but OpenFlow controllers have much more direct and powerful ways to force Open vSwitch to allocate memory, such as by inserting flows into the flow table."

notes.Note: mdeslaur> upstream is working to get this CVE rejected. https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-dev/2017-October/339432.html marking as ignored

criterions.comment: openvswitch: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
